{"blocks":[{"key":"3pctj","text":"Gibson Assembly technology uses homologous recombination to assemble adjacent DNA fragments that share end-terminal homology. The optimal length of the homologous fragment ends region depends on \nthe number and length of the fragments in the assembly reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":261}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
